lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
private static final String FILE_PATH = Paths.get(".", FILE_NAME).toString();
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for parsing user input and converting it into a {@code Command} object.
public static Command parse(String str) throws DukeException {
* The {@code Storage} class is responsible for loading and saving tasks to a file.
* Creates a new {@code Storage} object with the given file path.
* @param filePath The file path of the tasks file.
* Loads the tasks from the tasks file.
* @return An {@code ArrayList} of {@code Task} objects representing the loaded tasks.
* @throws DukeException If the tasks file cannot be found.
throw new DukeException("File not found: " + e.getMessage());
* Saves the given {@code TaskList} to the tasks file.
* Creates a {@code Task} object from a line of text in the tasks file.
* @param line The line of text to parse.
* @return A {@code Task} object, or {@code null} if the line is invalid.
System.out.println("\t\tHello, my name is Xilef.\n\t\tHow may I help you today??\n");
System.out.println("\t\tBye bye, see you next time!!!");
System.out.println("\t\tAdded a new task to the list!");
System.out.println("\t\tGreat job, you have accomplished this task:\n\t\t  " + task.toString() + "\n");
System.out.println("\t\tReminder, you have not completed this task yet:\n\t\t  " + task.toString() + "\n");
System.out.println("\t\tYou now have " + tasks.size() + " task remaining");
System.out.println("\t\tYou now have " + tasks.size() + " tasks remaining");
System.out.println("\t\tYou have " + tasks.size() + " too many task to do!!!" +
System.out.println("\t\tYou have " + tasks.size() + " too many tasks to do!!!" +
* An {@code AddCommand} is a {@code Command} that adds a {@code Task} to a {@code TaskList}.
* Creates a new {@code AddCommand} for a {@code Todo} task with the given description.
* @param desc The description of the {@code Todo} task.
* Creates a new {@code AddCommand} for a {@code Deadline} task with the given description and deadline.
* @param desc The description of the {@code Deadline} task.
* @param deadline The deadline of the {@code Deadline} task.
* Creates a new {@code AddCommand} for an {@code Event} task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param desc The description of the {@code Event} task.
* @param from The start time of the {@code Event} task.
* @param to The end time of the {@code Event} task.
public AddCommand(String desc, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
* Adds the task to the task list and saves the updated task list.
* Displays the task that was added to the user.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* An {@code Command} represents an operation that modifies the state of the application.
* Executes the command, modifying the state of the application.
* @param ui The {@code Ui} to display the results of the command.
* @param storage The {@code Storage} to save the modified state.
* @throws DukeException If the command cannot be executed due to an error.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* Returns whether the command should exit the application.
* @return {@code true} if the command should exit the application, otherwise {@code false}.
* Deletes a task from the task list.
* The index of the task to delete.
* Constructs a new {@code DeleteCommand} with the given index.
* Deletes the task at the given index from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to delete.
* Deletes the task at the given index from the task list and saves the updated task list.
* Displays the task that was deleted to the user.
* @throws DukeException If the index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("There is nothing to be deleted");
* Displays a message to the user indicating that the program is exiting.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
System.out.println("\t\tThere are no matching tasks in your list");
System.out.println("\t\tThese are the matching tasks in your list");
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
* Lists all tasks in the task list.
* Displays a message to the user if there are no tasks in the list.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
System.out.println("\t\tThere is nothing on your agenda");
System.out.println("\t\tThese are the things on your agenda today");
* The index of the task to mark as done.
* Constructs a new {@code MarkCommand} with the given index.
* Marks the task at the given index as done.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done.
* Marks the task at the given index as done and saves the updated task list.
* Displays the task that was marked to the user.
* @throws DukeException If the index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("There is nothing to be marked");
* Marks a task as not done.
* The index of the task to mark as not done.
* Constructs a new {@code UnmarkCommand} with the given index.
* Marks the task at the given index as not done.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as not done.
* Marks the task at the given index as not done and saves the updated task list.
* Displays the task that was unmarked to the user.
* @throws DukeException If the index is out of bounds.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("There is nothing to be unmarked");
* A {@code Deadline} is a type of {@code Task} with a deadline.
* Creates a new {@code Deadline} with the given description and deadline.
* @param description The description of the {@code Deadline}.
* @param deadline The deadline of the {@code Deadline}.
return "[D]" + super.toString() + " (by: " + deadline.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy| hh:mm a")) + ")";
* An {@code Event} is a type of {@code Task} with a start and end time.
* The start time of the {@code Event}.
* The end time of the {@code Event}.
* Creates a new {@code Event} with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the {@code Event}.
* @param from The start time of the {@code Event}.
* @param to The end time of the {@code Event}.
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime from, LocalDateTime to) {
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + from.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy| hh:mm a")) +
" to: " + to.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM yyyy| hh:mm a")) + ")";
* A {@code Task} represents a task with a description and a status (done or not done).
* Creates a new {@code Task} with the given description.
* @param description The description of the {@code Task}.
* Returns the status icon of the {@code Task}.
* @return The status icon of the {@code Task}.
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[ ]"); // mark done task with X
* Marks the {@code Task} as not done.
* A {@code TaskList} is a list of {@code Task} objects.
* Creates a new {@code TaskList} with an empty list of tasks.
* Creates a new {@code TaskList} with the given list of tasks.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return The number of tasks in the list.
* Returns the task at the given index.
* @param index The index of the task.
* @return The task at the given index.
* Removes the task at the given index.
* @param index The index of the task to remove.
* Adds a task to the list.
* A {@code Todo} is a type of {@code Task} with no associated date or time.
* Creates a new {@code Todo} with the given description.
* @param description The description of the {@code Todo}.
private static final DateTimeFormatter FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-dd-MM HHmm");
